meanings.definition: Arrange in a series or sequence.
meanings.sent1: She will seriate the books on the shelf by size.
meanings.sent2: Please seriate the numbers from smallest to largest.
meanings.sent3: The librarian decided to seriate the novels by genre for easier access.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts seemed to seriate themselves naturally, one after the other.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully seriated the colors in his painting to create a harmonious composition.

meanings.definition: To put in order or rank.
meanings.sent1: He likes to seriate his collection of stamps based on their value.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to seriate the historical events chronologically.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to seriate the ingredients before starting the recipe.
meanings.sent4: She tried to seriate her priorities but found it challenging.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to seriate the tasks according to their importance to meet the deadline.
